business.headline: Advance tax alert: First instalment due by June 15, find out if you are liableAdvance tax simply means paying your income tax in parts throughout the year, instead of waiting till the end. If your total tax due for the year is more than Rs 10,000, then you must pay it in advance in four instalments.
Iran-Israel tensions rise. Why India should worryThe escalating Iran-Israel conflict poses significant challenges for India, particularly concerning oil imports and economic stability.

Sensex settles 573 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; Adani Ports falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 573.38 points to end at 81,118.60, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 169.60 points to close at 24,718.60.

Gold prices rise sharply amid Israel-Iran tensions in IndiaThe rise in gold prices is being linked to worries over a possible wider conflict in the Middle East, which has made investors turn to gold as a safe place to park money.

Oswal Pumps opens Rs 1,387 crore IPO with strong brokerage backingOswal Pumps targets Rs 1,387.34 crore from IPO. Experts recommend subscribing due to strong fundamentals. IPO open until June 17, 2025.

Air India crash rattles hotel and ticketing stocks, as investor confidence waversOnline travel companies were among the most affected. Shares of Thomas Cook India fell by 2.39%, trading at Rs 160.03 as of June 13, 1PM. TBO Tek dropped 1.10% to Rs 1,287.40, while Mahindra Holidays slipped 1.47% to Rs 342.35.

Air India crash: How airline insurance works and why premiums may riseIncidents like the recent Air India crash can result in a total loss, meaning the aircraft is beyond repair with no salvageable parts. In such cases, the losses can reach around $130 million, roughly $80 million for the plane and $30-50 million in liabilities.

Who are the likely insurers for Air India plane crash?The plane involved in the crash was a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, one of the most modern aircraft used in commercial aviation. It was carrying 242 people, including 12 crew members.

Boeing's revival on trial after deadly Air India Dreamliner crash in AhmedabadThe fatal crash of Air India flight AI-171, a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, minutes after takeoff from Ahmedabad, has killed 241 people on board, reigniting serious doubts over Boeing's aircraft safety and corporate oversight.

Oil shock hits Dalal Street: BPCL, ONGC, IOC, other crude-sensitive stocks fallBrent crude oil futures jumped more than 9% to touch around $75.61 per barrel, reaching a multi-month high. The gain came after Israel said it had launched what it called "preemptive strikes" against Iran.

RBI steps in to contain fallout of oil price jump on rupee: ReportThe Indian rupee dropped to 86.20 against the US dollar in early trade but later recovered to 86.04, helped by the central bank's likely intervention.

Aviation stocks tumble after Air India plane crash in AhmedabadSpiceJet's share price dropped 3.42% at the start of the trading session. InterGlobe Aviation Ltd, the company that runs IndiGo, also fell 4.83%, slipping to Rs 5,212 in early trade.

Sensex falls over 1,100 points. Why is the stock market falling today?The BSE Sensex was down 1121.35 points to 80,570.63 at 9:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 334.65 points to trade at 24,553.55.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty crash today over Israel-Iran conflict?The situation in the Middle East has affected global investor sentiment. Oil prices also jumped on fears that the strikes could affect supply from the region, which is known for producing large amounts of oil.

Stocks to watch on June 13: Tata Group, RIL, HCL, Asian Paints, ICRA, ICICI BankShares of several Tata Group companies, such as Tata Motors, Tata Steel and Tata Chemicals, are expected to remain in the spotlight after the crash of Air India flight AI171 in Ahmedabad shortly after takeoff.

Boeing shares slide 5% after Air India Dreamliner crash kills over 200Flight AI171, bound for London, went down minutes after departure, killing more than 200 people in what is now the world's deadliest aviation disaster in a decade. The cause of the crash remains unclear.

Tata Group to give Rs 1 crore to families of Ahmedabad Air India crash victimsTata Group will offer Rs 1 crore to family members of people who lost their lives in the Ahmedabad crash of Air India Flight 171, which killed over 200 people on Thursday.

This is a difficult day for us: Air India CEO reacts to Ahmedabad plane crashAt least 204 people were killed and 41 injured after the London-bound Air India flight crashed just minutes after taking off from Ahmedabad's Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport on Thursday.

Retail inflation hits six-year low, falls to 2.82% in May 2025The decline in retail inflation is mainly because food prices rose at a much slower pace than before. Cheaper vegetables, fruits, cereals, and pulses helped bring food inflation down sharply. In May, food inflation fell to 0.99% from 1.78% in April.

Sensex tanks 823 points, Nifty falls below 25,000; Tata Motors falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 823.16 points to close at 81,691.98, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 253.20 points to settle at 24,888.20.

Boeing reacts to Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad, says aware of initial reportsThe London-bound flight AI-171, carrying 242 people including 230 passengers and 12 crew members, crashed in the Meghaninagar area near the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport minutes after takeoff. The plane had issued a mayday call before losing contact with air traffic control.

Shocked and deeply saddened: Gautam Adani after Air India plane crash in AhmedabadOn Thursday afternoon, an Air India flight heading to London crashed just minutes after take-off, with 242 people on board. The flight, AI-171, was being operated by a Boeing 787 Dreamliner.

Focus on supporting affected people: Tata Group chief on Ahmedabad plane crashThe airplane crash has led to a temporary suspension of flight operations at Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport.

Boeing shares tumble 8% after Air India flight crashes in AhmedabadBoeing shares nosedived over 8% in pre-market trade after the Air India Dreamliner crash in Ahmedabad, deepening investor concerns over the jetmaker's safety record and regulatory troubles.

Google offers buyout plans amid AI-focused overhaul: ReportGoogle is now giving some employees the option to leave the company with a severance package. This is being called a "voluntary exit programme", as per reports.

Dalal Street dips nearly 1 percent on global trade and geopolitical concernsStock market today: The fall occurred despite markets erasing early losses as the S&P BSE Sensex fell by 911 points to 81,603.95 and the NSE Nifty50 lost 288.75 points to 24,854.45 by 2:29 pm.

India to tighten remittance rules, bar offshore time deposits: ReportThe Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will amend regulations to prevent overseas transfers from being used to park money in time deposits or other interest-bearing accounts abroad, one of the sources said.

PM-Kisan 20th instalment: When will farmers get the next Rs 2,000?This scheme provides income support of Rs 6,000 a year to eligible farmers. The money is paid in three equal parts of Rs 2,000, directly into the farmers' bank accounts.

Dollar dream vs reality: Why Rs 80 lakh in US salary not as big as it soundsRs 23 lakh in India can go as far as Rs 80 lakh in the US when it comes to daily living costs. An upcoming author reveals the impact of Purchasing Power Parity (PPP) on salary comparisons between India and the US.
Elon Musk's net worth jumps after apology to Donald TrumpElon Musk's net worth increased by $191 million, reaching $411.4 billion after his public apology to President Donald Trump.

Got an income tax notice? Don't panic, here's how to deal with itFor many honest taxpayers, the unexpected arrival of an income tax notice in their inbox can trigger anxiety. However, most of them are often routine and manageable. This article explains what these notices really mean, why they're sent, and what you should do if one lands your way.

India's AI market to triple by 2027 with strong talent and tech growthThe report, titled "India's AI Leap: BCG Perspective on Emerging Challengers," indicates that the country is set to become one of the fastest-growing AI economies globally.

Paytm shares slide up to 10% after government dismisses MDR rumoursPaytm shares fell sharply in early trade after the government rejected reports suggesting the return of merchant discount rate (MDR) charges on UPI transactions.

Stock market today: Sensex and Nifty likely to open flat. Here's whyAs of 8:34 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,236.5, suggesting that the Nifty 50 index will open close to Wednesday's closing level of 25,141.4.

Stocks to watch on June 12: Wipro, HDFC Bank, IREDA, Nazara Tech, NTPCThe Sensex and Nifty closed higher after a rangebound session on Wednesday. While gains in IT stocks supported the indices, profit booking and the absence of strong triggers limited the overall rise.

Dubai's billionaire realty map: Can India's salaried class invest there?For years, Dubai's skyline has glittered like a dream, much like that tempting NRI cousin who always seemed a step ahead in life. But things are changing as salaried Indians are looking to venture into Dubai's posh real estate.

entertainment.headline: The Traitors Season 4 begins filming with Alan Cumming and star castPeacock's The Traitors returns for Season 4 with Alan Cumming and a star-studded cast from Survivor, Big Brother, Drag Race, and more. Filming is underway in the Scottish Highlands.

Country star Lauren Alaina gives birth to baby girl Beni Doll ArnoldCountry star Lauren Alaina and husband Cam Arnold welcomed their daughter, Beni Doll Arnold, on June 11. Alaina released a tribute song, "Heaven Sent," honoring her late father and newborn.

Air India crash reignites Boeing concerns: Here's what global documentaries revealThe recent Air India crash in Ahmedabad has once again cast a spotlight on Boeing. As questions mount about potential technical failures, several documentaries have resurfaced, shedding light on Boeing's troubled history.

Amitabh Bachchan expresses grief over Air India crash, sends prayersMegastar Amitabh Bachchan sent prayers for the victims and families of those affected by the Air India flight crash in Ahmedabad. Several celebrities from the Indian film industry have shared their condolences on social media.

You're sharing them: Sabrina Carpenter defends racy artwork and lyrics of her songsIn a recent interview, singer-songwriter Sabrina Carpenter clapped back at the critics, addressing the backlash she received for her recent cover artwork for her upcoming album 'Man's Best Friend'.

Actor Unni Mukundan recalls growing up near Air India crash site: Spent 24 yearsMalayalam actor Unni Mukundan spent his childhood and adolescence in Ahmedabad and stayed in proximity to the Air India flight crash site until he turned 24. He expressed deep shock over the tragic crash that claimed 265 lives.

Allu Arjun, Basil Joseph to collaborate on a superhero film: ReportAfter locking 'AA22' with Atlee, superstar Allu Arjun is now eyeing a fresh collaboration with Malayalam director Basil Joseph for what's rumoured to be a superhero film.

BTS reunion: What it means for the fandom and Indian ARMYBTS's six members have completed their military service, promising a long-awaited reunion with fans globally, especially the passionate Indian ARMY. Their comeback marks not just a musical event but a cultural and economic milestone poised to energise India's live music scene.

Ajith Kumar, 54, leaves fans swooning with recent public appearance in ChennaiActor Ajith Kumar was clicked leaving the passport office in Chennai earlier today. As soon as the clip surfaced online, fans couldn't help but gush over the look in a formal outfit.

Harshvardhan Rane-Sonam Bajwa's Deewaniyat set catches fire amid celebrationA freak incident occurred on the sets of Harshvardhan Rane and Sonam Bajwa's 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' on Thursday when helium balloons caught fire. However, no injuries were reported.

Actor Sana Makbul diagnosed with liver cirrhosis, hopes to avoid transplantActor Sana Makbul's health has taken a serious turn as she's been diagnosed with liver cirrhosis. She shared that she has begun immunotherapy and is now focused on her recovery.

Sonam Bajwa joins Diljit Dosanjh in Border 2, to start shooting this month: ReportActor Sonam Bajwa reportedly joined the cast of Sunny Deol starrer 'Border 2'. She is expected to start shooting for the film by the end of June and has been paired opposite Diljit Dosanjh.

Nagarjuna calls Rajnikanth's Coolie whistle-worthy film, praises Lokesh KanagarajAhead of his big release 'Coolie', actor Nagarjuna Akkineni spoke about working with director Lokesh Kanagaraj, calling him a 'whistle factor' and recalled the massive fan response he witnessed on the streets of Chennai.

Chatha Pacha: Roshan Mathew's WWE-inspired Malayalam wrestling film beginsDirected by debutant Adhvaith Nayar, the wrestling film titled 'Chatha Pacha' stars Roshan Mathew, Arjun Ashokan, Vishak Nair and Ishan Shaukath in lead roles.

Materialists review: This romance glitters, but fades like perfume in windReleased-Fri Jun 13, 2025'Materialists' works well when it shows a flawed, ambitious, beautiful woman just trying to live her best life. But, what she preaches, and the choices she makes, especially when it comes to men, doesn't really seem right. Also, how does a romantic film work in the absence of good intimate scenes, especially when you have such pretty faces leading the story?

Munawar Faruqui hangs out with newlyweds Hina Khan and Rocky Jaiswal on show setsActors Hina Khan and Rocky Jaiswal met comedian Munawar Faruqui on the sets of their upcoming show, 'Pati Patni Aur Panga.' They were seen spending quality time on the sets of the show.

Alia Bhatt, Sharvari to feature in special dance track for action film Alpha: ReportActors Alia Bhatt and Sharvari are working hard on a special dance song for their new action film 'Alpha'. The movie will release in theatres during Christmas 2025 and also stars Anil Kapoor and Bobby Deol.

Sussanne Khan grateful and blessed to have Hrithik Roshan as co-parentSussanne Khan reflected on co-parenting with actor Hrithik Roshan, shedding light on their commitment to providing a nurturing environment for their sons.

general news.headline: Iran claims 78 killed, over 320 wounded in fresh Israeli attacks Live UpdatesThe statement came shortly after Iran launched a barrage of long-range missiles at Tel Aviv, Israel's commercial hub, leaving at least 34 people injured.

US helping intercept Iranian missiles aimed at Israel: ReportThe US military assisted Israel in intercepting Iranian missiles launched in retaliation for Israeli strikes. US officials confirmed involvement but gave no details on the assets used in the operation.

Big order for all Air India Boeing Dreamliners after deadly Ahmedabad crashThe Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has ordered enhanced safety checks for Boeing Dreamliner planes operated by Air India, in view of the deadly Ahmedabad crash that claimed at least 265 lives.

We knew everything, still hopes for nuclear deal: Trump on Israel's Iran strikesUS President Donald Trump confirmed US had prior knowledge of Israel's Iran strikes, praised the operation, urged diplomacy, and reaffirmed strong US-Israel ties despite rising regional tensions and Iranian retaliation.

I don't want to be next: How Air India crash must have shaken pilots at AhmedabadThe Air India Flight 171 crash shook many, but what must it have been like for the pilots in line to take off from Ahmedabad after the ill-fated jet? Despite rigorous training, pilots admit that fear lingers, but they rely on muscle memory and a problem-solving mindset to carry on.

Almost-intact Bhagavad Gita emerges from burnt debris at Air India crash siteIn the wreckage of the Air India Flight 171 crash in Ahmedabad that killed 265 people, an almost-intact copy of the Bhagavad Gita was found at the site. Despite the intense fire, the holy book remained largely unharmed.

Israel destroyed above-ground enrichment facility at Natanz site: UN nuclear chiefIsrael's strikes destroyed Iran's Natanz nuclear site, the UN nuclear watchdog confirmed, as tensions escalated with retaliatory attacks and warnings from both nations at the UN Security Council.

PM shares India's concerns in call from Netanyahu, briefed on situation with IranPM Modi received a call from Israeli counterpart Benjamin Netanyahu, and briefed him on India's concerns. Besides, the PM was briefed on developments in the ongoing Israel-Iran conflict

When a Pak fighter jet shot down Gujarat CM's plane 60 years agoSixty years before former Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani lost his life in the Air India crash on Thursday, a sitting Gujarat CM was lost mid-air, not to malfunction, but to a Pakistani strike. During the India-Pakistan War of 1965, a Pakistani fighter shot down Balwantrai Mehta's Beechcraft aircraft, perceiving it as to be a surveillance aircraft.

Live: Iran launches new missile wave, air raid sirens sound in Tel AvivIsrael Iran War News Live: Iran's UN envoy on Friday condemned the United States as complicit in deadly Israeli airstrikes that he said killed 78 people, including senior military officials, and injured more than 320, mostly civilians. He asserted that by supporting and enabling the attacks, the US bears full responsibility for their consequences. The statement comes hours after Iran launched a massive missile and drone attack on Israel, calling it "Operation True Promise," in response to Israeli strikes on its nuclear and military sites. Earlier, on Friday, Israel launched a series of large-scale airstrikes on Iran, hitting two nuclear facilities, in what Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu described as the opening phase of a prolonged military operation. The unprecedented attack has sharply escalated tensions across the Middle East, raising fears of a broader regional conflict. Israel is now on high alert, preparing for Iran's retaliation. Stay with Indiatoday.in for LIVE updates.

Was stuck in traffic, it's my rebirth: Woman who missed London flight by 10 minutesThe check-in gates were closed at 1.10 pm. However, she reached the airport at around 1.20 pm, which ultimately resulted in her missing the flight.

Man slips while getting off local train at Mumbai's Ghatkopar station, diesA passenger died after his foot slipped and he fell on the railway track while trying to get off a local train at Mumbai's Ghatkopar station.
Can a perfume put you to good night's sleep?Not just a pre-date ritual, perfumes are now part of bedtime routines—and they're helping people sleep like babies. There's science to back it up, too.

Black box of Air India flight recovered from rooftop of building it hitA day after the Air India Ahmedabad-London flight crash in Ahmedabad, investigators have located the black box, an important device that will help investigate what led to the accident.

One of the darkest days: Tata chairman writes to colleagues on Air India crashTata Group and Air India Chairman N Chandrasekharan called Air India flight crash day one of the darkest days in the group's history.

Air India crash videos suggest errors in cockpit take-off drillsThe analysis explores probable causes of the catastrophic crash, focusing on the Air India plane's low altitude, low speed, and landing gear configuration, based on crash videos.

Trojan horse drug to help treat blood cancer patients: What is it?UK's health authorities will offer a new targeted treatment for patients suffering from an aggressive blood cancer. This therapy is also known as "Trojan Horse".

Iran hardliners dead now, and it'll get worse: Trump urges Tehran to make a dealDonald Trump claimed that he and his administration had prior information that Israel was going to strike Iran and he hopes that Iran will return to the negotiating table following the strikes.

One was to quit, another just started: Tale of two pilots of Air India crashWhile Captain Sumeet Sabharwal was days away from quitting flying, First Officer Clive Kunder was just starting his career in the skies. Both the pilots commanding the Air India Dreamliner died when their aircraft crashed in Ahmedabad, killing all, but one, on board.

sports.headline: SA will be chasing their hardest 69 runs vs AUS on Day 4: SteynSouth Africa are on the verge of a historic win in the World Test Championship Final, but Dale Steyn believes the side will face the toughest 69 runs they've ever had to score on Saturday.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
